page.title: 12COMMUNITY SERVICE SCHEME
page.content:
The{SOCIAL WORK DEPARTMENT}of the Highland Regional Council started this scheme in January, 1984. What used to be Culduthel Primary School is used for a workshop for offenders who break the law. They are aged between 16 and 45 years, both male and female.
They make toys which are given to hospitals and the Ethiopian Appeal. They also work in the community, helping old people by digging gardens, chopping sticks, sawing logs and many other things.
The Service Scheme operates from Monday to Saturday.
